VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Allow a Buyer to Change a Product's Quantity to Zero on the Shopping Cart Page

Provide an intuitive experience for a buyer who wants to remove a product from their cart on the Shopping Cart page. You can provide the option for a buyer to change a product's quantity in the cart to zero, which removes the product from the cart. You can also specify whether the buyer receives a prompt to confirm the change.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

Maybe most buyers prefer to remove an item from the cart by clicking Delete (1) on the cart item. But, maybe some buyers prefer to change the selected quantity for a cart item to zero (2), and then click Update (3). You can provide the following experiences:

Only provide the Delete button for the cart item, and disallow changing the quantity to zero. The buyer can't specify a quantity less than one, or whatever the product's minimum allowed quantity.
Both provide the Delete button for the item and allow changing the quantity to zero.

When you allow changing the quantity to zero, you can specify whether the buyer receives a prompt to confirm that they want to remove the item. The confirmation window appears after they click Update. Alternatively, the item is removed immediately after the buyer clicks Update, which matches the behavior when the buyer clicks Delete.

NOTE The confirmation window isn’t available for attribute-based products.

To configure options for a cart item's zero quantity, update your storefront configuration settings:

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Cart (3).
To allow a buyer to specify a quantity of zero, find the Allow Zero Quantity configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Allow Zero Quantity
Page	all
Value	TRUE
NOTE When you enable Cart Scale in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), the Scaled Cart page replaces the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 but still respects this configuration. A buyer can still remove a product from the cart on the Scaled Cart page by entering a quantity of zero.
To prompt a buyer to confirm whether they want to remove the item, find the Verify Zero Quantity configuration (4). Make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Verify Zero Quantity
Page	all
Value	TRUE
WARNING When you enable Cart Scale in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), the Scaled Cart page replaces the Shopping Cart page version 2.0. This configuration isn't compatible with the Scaled Cart page. When you're using Cart Scale and this configuration is TRUE, the prompt window doesn't open for the buyer to confirm the item's removal.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
